fields.label: Title of Change
fields.value: Installation and Qualification of NanoRam 1064 Handheld Raman Spectrometer and its respective data management software, NID EX for Tampa site.

fields.label: Impacted Products
fields.value:
030 - Sulfacetamide Sodium Ophthalmic Solution, 10%
034 - Neomycin and Polymyxin B Sulfates and Gramicidin Ophthalmic Solution

rows.description: Execute Installation and Qualification protocols in accordance with Tampa Site SOP46-060. Attach approved protocol(s) and report(s)
Confirm required hardware PMs were created in Maximo/BMRAM
Show active status for all users ITCR to add all Confirm PMs were created in Maximo and show active status
Confirm PMs were created in Maximo and show active status

fields.label: Description
fields.value:
Installation and Qualification of three NanoRam 1064 handheld spectrometer units, its operating system NOS-1064, and its respective data management software, NID EX for Tampa site.

This change includes the installation and qualification of three NanoRam 1064 units, the operating system NOS-1064 and data management software, NID EX. The new Raman spectrometer units operational under its own operating software, NOS-1064 with data management software, NID EX. The new units will be utilized by IQ for ID testing of applicable packaging components and raw materials used in Tampa manufacturing facility. This chemical ID testing offers time reduction and cost savings to the Tampa site with respect to lab testing time, while maintaining data integrity for a robust system platform in product testing. The new units will be utilized by IQ for ID testing of LIMS Paperless Lab packaging project components and raw materials. This implementation effort supports the CORE 2.0 LIMS Paperless Lab project.

fields.label: Additional Impact Information
fields.value: CMC-US, ROW and Canada- There is no regulatory action for completion of IQOQ activities. As stated in description of changes, the updates to product specifications and associated test methods will be managed under separate QCR(s). Thus, the IQOQ activities impact. As stated in description of changes, the updates to material specifications and methods to test via the Raman Spectrometer will be assessed under these subsequent QCRs.

fields.label: Justification for No Effectiveness Check
fields.value: Successful completion of qualification activities and approved final report for the three NanoRam 1064 handheld Raman spectrometer units and associated software.

fields.label: Effectiveness Criteria
fields.value: Successful completion of qualification activities and change plan items for release of instrument and software.

fields.label: Impact
fields.value: This change is to install and qualify three NanoRam 1064-handheld Raman spectrometers, the unit's operating system NOS 1064 and the data management software NID EX, at Tampa site, this change will occur in IQ area where the Raman spectrometers are used in manufacturing. Alternative ID testing for applicable packaging components and raw materials to be tested. The Regulatory Impact on ID test methods will be developed and validated associated test methods will be assessed and managed under separate QCR(s). The qualification of the NanoRam 1064 units will not be conducted by IR. New SOPs/WIs for operational shutdown and will have no impact to the current QC Chemistry lab testing for ID applicable documentation procedures.

fields.label: Justification
fields.value: The implementation of the Raman system: NanoRam 1064 units and NID EX data management software as the first system of its kind at B&L Tampa site, provide alternative chemical ID testing for applicable packaging components and raw materials with cost savings attached. To IQOQ lab testing once the NanoRam 1064 and associated software are installed and qualified, the system is to be utilized along with existing FTIR instrument for ID testing. Both the Raman system and FTIR instruments, in accordance, will fully functional and operational to support ID testing for raw materials and packaging components with their respective specifications.
